title: Donald Trump says relationship with Elon Musk is over
byline: US President Donald Trump has said his relationship with Elon Musk is over.

title: Legal action taken against 55 persons for traffic violations in Kattankudy
byline: Legal action has been taken against 55 individuals who violated traffic regulations in Kattankudy, Batticaloa, Police said.

title: China remains a steadfast partner: Dy Minister
byline: “China is one of the friendliest countries to Sri Lanka, and we hope that this friendship will last a long time,” Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways Prasanna Gunasena has said.

title: Showery conditions to enhance from Tuesday
byline: Showery conditions are expected to enhance in the southwestern part of the island from Tuesday (10), with strong wind gusts over the island and in the sea areas, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Free special train services to operate for Poson festival
byline: Sri Lanka Railways (SLR) has announced the operation of a series of special train services in view of the Poson festival.

title: Around 1,200 unsafe railway crossings identified across the country, says Railway GM
byline: The Committee on Public Accounts (COPA) has revealed that the majority of accidents at railway crossings occur at crossings equipped with safety systems.

title: Suspect arrested in Mattakkuliya with T-56 assault rifle and ammo
byline: A suspect has been arrested in the Sampathpura area of the Mattakkuliya Police Division with a T-56 firearm and 29 rounds of ammunition.

title: Colombian presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe shot in Bogota
byline: Colombian senator Miguel Uribe, in the running to join next year’s presidential race, is in a critical condition in hospital after being shot at an event in Bogota, according to national police and prosecutors.

title: Veterinary surgeons to launch token strike tomorrow
byline: The State Veterinary Surgeons’ Association has decided to launch a 24-hour token strike starting at 6.00 a.m. tomorrow (June 9).

title: Education Ministry issues instructions to prevent dengue and chikungunya in schools
byline: The Ministry of Education has issued a special set of instructions on how to prevent dengue and Chikungunya in schools.

title: Wholesale price of cement to be increased
byline: The wholesale price per 50-kilogram bag of cement will be increased by Rs. 100 each, according to cement company sources.

title: Four drown in Bala Ella Wewa in Polonnaruwa
byline: Four persons have reportedly drowned while bathing in the Bala Ella Wewa in Polonnaruwa, police said.

title: SpaceX’s Falcon 9 successfully launches SXM-10 satellite into space
byline: SpaceX launched its first customer mission of the month shortly after midnight on Saturday morning with a Falcon 9 flight heading to a geosynchronous transfer orbit.

title: Sri Lanka Customs issues clarification on contents of controversial containers
byline: Sri Lanka Customs says that the contents of the 323 controversial shipping containers released without inspection were industrial goods and raw materials, according to the documents declared by the importers before they were released.

title: Presidential Pardon for Vesak misused to illegally release several prisoners: Police
byline: Sri Lanka Police says that a statement has been recorded from the Commissioner General of Prisons regarding the controversial release of prisoners on a Presidential Pardon for Vesak.

title: Chamod Yodhasinghe wins bronze at Taiwan Athletics Open
byline: Sri Lanka’s Chamod Mahinsasa Yodhasinghe has won third place in the Men’s 100m event at the Taiwan Open Athletics Championship 2025 with a time of 10.38 seconds.

title: Special security and traffic plan in Anuradhapura and Mihintale for Poson
byline: A special security arraignment and a traffic plan are in place for the Poson festive season, centered around the sacred cities of Anuradhapura and Mihintale, according to Sri Lanka Police.

title: Blue-and-yellow Macaw stolen from Dehiwala Zoo for second time
byline: A Blue-and-yellow Macaw, reported to be worth over Rs. 500,000, has been stolen from a cage at the Dehiwala National Zoo.

title: Trump deploys National Guard as Los Angeles protests against immigration agents continue
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration said it would deploy 2,000 National Guard troops on Saturday as federal agents in Los Angeles faced off against a few hundred demonstrators during a second day of protests following immigration raids.

title: Trump says Musk could face ‘serious consequences’ if he backs Democratic candidates
byline: President Donald Trump is not backing off his battle with Elon Musk, saying Saturday that he has no desire to repair their relationship and warning that his former ally and campaign benefactor could face “serious consequences” if he tries to help Democrats in upcoming elections.

title: Valaichchenai Paper Mill now generating profit: Handunneththi
byline: The state-owned Valaichchenai Paper Mill is currently operating at a profit, according to Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Sunil Handunneththi.

title: Minister Harshana elected President of Sri Lanka-Germany Parliamentary Friendship Association
byline: Minister of Justice and National Integration Harshana Nanayakkara, Attorney-at-Law, has been elected as the President of the Sri Lanka - Germany Parliamentary Friendship Association for the Tenth Parliament.

title: Nadeesha Lekamge wins silver with season’s best at Taiwan Athletics Open
byline: Sri Lanka’s Nadeesha Lekamge secured the silver medal in the women’s javelin throw event at the 2025 Taiwan Open Athletics Championship, held on Sunday (June 8), with a season’s best performance of 56.62 meters.

title: Mobile App introduced for devotees visiting Anuradhapura for Poson Festival
byline: Steps have been taken to provide all necessary information to devotees visiting Anuradhapura for the Poson Festival through a mobile phone application.

title: Assistant Commissioner of Anuradhapura Prison arrested by CID
byline: The Assistant Commissioner of the Anuradhapura Prison has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), this afternoon (08).

title: India reports 6 Covid-19 deaths in 24 hours, active cases rise to 6,133
byline: India’s active Covid-19 case tally has risen to 6,133 with 378 fresh cases reported in the past 24 hours, according to the latest data released by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare of India.

title: ‘Deputy Chief Sanghanayaka of Southern Sri Lanka’ title conferred to Ven. Mapalagama Buddhasiri Thero
byline: Venerable Mapalagama Buddhasiri Thero, Chief Incumbent of the Weherahena Rajamaha Viharaya in Matara has been conferred the title of Deputy Chief Sanghanayaka of Southern Sri Lanka.
